ol.li: SHALL conform to Simple Observation template (templateId: 1.3.6.1.4.1.19376.1.5.3.1.4.13)
SHALL conform to CCD Family History Observation template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.22)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.2 Problem Type STATIC 1
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] value, where its data type is CD
SHALL conform to CCD Family History Observation template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.22)
SHALL conform to Simple Observation template (templateId: 1.3.6.1.4.1.19376.1.5.3.1.4.13)
Contains exactly one [1..1] @classCode, where its data type is ActClassObservation
Contains exactly one [1..1] @moodCode, where its data type is x_ActMoodDocumentObservation
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode/@code="completed" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 HL7ActStatus)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.2 Problem Type STATIC 1
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] value, where its data type is CD

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF-224), such that
Contains @typeCode="SUBJ" SUBJ (has subject)
Contains exactly one [1..1] Age Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.38)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF-207), such that
Contains exactly one [1..1] Problem Status Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.50)

SHALL contain at least one [1..*] entryRelationship (CONF-197, CONF-198), such that
Contains @typeCode="CAUS" CAUS (is etiology for)
Contains exactly one [1..1] Cause Of Death Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.42)

A family history observation not contained within a family history organizer SHALL contain exactly one subject participant, representing the family member who is the subject of the observation (CONF-209)
[OCL]: self.subject->size() > 0

Where the subject of an observation is explicit in a family history observation code (e.g. SNOMED CT concept 417001009 "Family history of tuberous sclerosis"), the subject participant SHALL be equivalent to or further specialize the code (CONF-210)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

Where the subject of an observation is not explicit in a family history observation code (e.g. SNOMED CT concept 44054006 "Diabetes Mellitus type 2"), the subject participant SHALL be used to assert the affected relative (CONF-211)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

A subject participant SHALL contain exactly one RelatedSubject, representing the relationship of the subject to the patient
[OCL]: self.subject.relatedSubject->size() = 1

The value for RelatedSubject / @classCode SHALL be "PRS" "Personal relationship" 2.16.840.1.113883.5.110 RoleClass STATIC
[OCL]: self.subject.relatedSubject.classCode = vocab::x_DocumentSubject::PRS

RelatedSubject SHALL contain exactly one RelatedSubject / code (CONF-214)
[OCL]: self.subject.relatedSubject.code->size() = 1

The value for "RelatedSubject / code" SHOULD be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19579 FamilyHistoryRelatedSubjectCode DYNAMIC or 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20.21 FamilyHistoryPersonCode DYNAMIC
[OCL]: self.subject.relatedSubject.code.codeSystem = '2.16.840.1.113883.5.111'

Representation of a pedigree graph SHALL be done using RelatedSubject / code values (e.g. "great grandfather") to designate a hierarchical family tree.
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

RelatedSubject SHOULD contain exactly one RelatedSubject / subject
[OCL]: self.subject.relatedSubject.subject->size() = 1

RelatedSubject / subject SHOULD contain exactly one RelatedSubject / subject / administrativeGenderCode.
[OCL]: self.subject.relatedSubject.subject.administrativeGenderCode->size() = 1

SHOULD satisfy: subject/relatedSubject/subject contains exactly one birthTime (CONF-219)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE
[OCL]: self.subject.relatedSubject.subject.birthTime->size() = 1

MAY satisfy: subject/relatedSubject/subject contains exactly one sdtc:deceasedInd (CONF-220)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

MAY satisfy: subject/relatedSubject/subject contains exactly one sdtc:deceasedTime (CONF-221)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

SHOULD satisfy: The age of a relative at the time of observation is inferred by comparing subject/relatedSubject/subject/birthTime with Observation/effectiveTime (CONF-222)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

MAY satisfy: The age of a relative at the time of death is inferred by comparing subject/relatedSubject/subject/birthTime with subject/relatedSubject/subject/sdtc:deceasedTime. (CONF-223)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

SHALL satisfy: Contains one or more sources of information (CONF-199)
UNIMPLEMENTABLE

A family history cause of death observation SHALL contain one or more entryRelationship / @typeCode
UNIMPLEMENTABLE
